isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO SERIES - INSTALL

svcproc.title: REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: If you install the lower reverse idler gear assembly, make sure the three (3) magnetic discs are securely in place at case bottom. Use Eaton Adhesive #71210 or Loctite 277.

step1.para: If reverse gear assembly is disassembled, position the needle bearing and inner race into the reverse idler gear ( Figure 196).
Thread the pipe plug into the reverse idler shaft and tighten ( Figure 196).
Position the idler shaft plate on the reverse idler shaft, flat side to the front ( Figure 196).

Insert the idler shaft into the case bore, threaded-end to the front. As the shaft passes through the case bore, position the reverse idler gear on the shaft, long hub to the front Figure 197). Insert the thrust washer between the reverse idler gear and the case support boss. Finish inserting the idler shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 197. Reverse Idler Gear On Shaft

step1.para: Make sure the reverse idler shaft is seated in the support boss bore.
Install the washer and lock nut on shaft front. Tighten the stop nut to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 N•m) of torque ( Figure 198).

figure.caption: Figure 198. Washer And Lock Nut On Shaft Front

step1.para: Use a bearing driver and maul and install the auxiliary countershaft front bearing outer race against the idler plate ( Figure 199).

figure.caption: Figure 199. Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing Outer Race
